content.question: A block is hung vertically from an ideal spring. The block is pulled down, released, and allowed to oscillate. The vertical position <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math> of the block as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is shown in the graph. Which of the following graphs best represents the corresponding acceleration <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> of the block as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure shows a sinusoidal curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “t,” and the vertical axis is labeled “a.” The curve has two peaks two valleys. The curve begins at a peak, one unit to the left of the a axis and two units above the t axis. The second peak is a little more than one and a half units to the right of the a axis. The first valley is a little less than a half unit to the right of the a axis, and the second valley is a little more than two and a half units to the right of the a axis. After the second valley, the curve moves briefly upward and to the right until it ends just below the t axis.
